content:
• Friday, July 26, 2013
  • ERJ

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: ERJ +3%. KNDI +2%. MTSN +2%. AMX +2%. RSH +1%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: ERJ +3%. KNDI +2%. MTSN +2%. AMX +2%. RSH +1%.
    After-hours top losers: DLR -3%. CAR -3%. QCOR -2%. GLNG -2%. FLY -1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM
  • ISIL

    Intersil (NASDAQ:ISIL) will reduce its workforce by ~150 employees as part of a "resource...

    Intersil (NASDAQ:ISIL) will reduce its workforce by ~150 employees as part of a "resource rebalancing initiative designed to better align the company's operating expenses with strategic growth areas." The company hopes the plan will make it more competitive by, among other things, "shift[ing] more resources to product development" - restructuring charges are expected to be between $8-12M. ISIL also reports revenue of $144.8M for Q2. Shares +1.5% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:09 PM
  • MNTA

    Momenta Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:MNTA) jumped 11.73% Friday after the U.S. Court of Appeals for...

    Momenta Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:MNTA) jumped 11.73% Friday after the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit invalidated "several" Copaxone (NYSE:TEVA) patents, "potentially clear[ing] the way for market entry of a generic [version] as early as May 2014." Bernstein's Ronny Gal says MNTA could hit $30/ share if the company "is able to introduce the first generic Copaxone" by that date.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM | 3 Comments
  • GLNG

    Liquefied natural gas shipper Golar LNG (GLNG +4.6%) powered higher following earlier news that...

    Liquefied natural gas shipper Golar LNG (GLNG +4.6%) powered higher following earlier news that it secured $1.125B in financing for the first eight of 13 planned newbuild vessels and FSRUs. In anticipation of the financing, GLNG had entered into interest rate swaps to hedge much of the loan so that the all-in interest cost for the initial seven years of the facility will be ~3.74%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM | 1 Comment

  • The week's ETF movers - Gainers: GDXJ +8.99%. URA +7.29%. GDX +6.73%. IAU +3.02%. PSLV +2.98%....

    The week's ETF movers - Gainers: GDXJ +8.99%. URA +7.29%. GDX +6.73%. IAU +3.02%. PSLV +2.98%.
    ETF Losers: UNG -5.49%. GAZ -5.47%. EWJ -4.77%. VXX -4.02%. XHB -3.83%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • HAL

    Moody's lowers its outlook on Halliburton (HAL +3.7%) to negative from stable while affirming an...

    Moody's lowers its outlook on Halliburton (HAL +3.7%) to negative from stable while affirming an A2 credit rating after the oilfield services company unveiled plans to launch a modified Dutch auction tender for up to $3.3B of its stock. The ratings agency views HAL's increased buybacks as aggressive given the cyclicality of its earnings; the tender offer effectively targets to repurchase 10% of outstanding shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 1 Comment
  • DRC

    Dresser-Rand's (DRC -5.2%) Q2 earnings rose more than expected, but the equipment maker warned...

    Dresser-Rand's (DRC -5.2%) Q2 earnings rose more than expected, but the equipment maker warned that its new-unit bookings have slowed. J.P. Morgan notes DRC's caution follows recent comments from fellow oil equipment companies FMC Tech (FTI -2%) and Cameron (CAM -4.4%) about delayed orders and project progression hitting the latest and near-term future results (I, II).

     
     
     
     
    | 3:22 PM
  • BCS

    Barclays (BCS -1.9%) is sliding on a WSJ report it is readying a massive share sale to help it...

    Barclays (BCS -1.9%) is sliding on a WSJ report it is readying a massive share sale to help it meet a capital deficit created by new regulations. When it announces Q2 results next Tuesday, BCS reportedly will unveil plans to issue billions of pounds worth of new securities to fill a £7B ($10.8B) capital deficit U.K. regulators have identified at the bank and to erase investor worries about the adequacy of its capital.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:09 PM
  • LEU

    USEC (USU +36%) is making another big move today, and shares have now more than tripled since...

    USEC (USU +36%) is making another big move today, and shares have now more than tripled since closing at $6.05 last Friday. Speculation centers around recent elections in Japan and the possibility of firing up more nuclear plants in the country. Uranium Resources (URRE +27.2%) also is surging on the back of USEC, but it's up a mere 52% on the week.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM | 6 Comments
  • GME

    Shares of GameStop (GME +2.9%) trade higher with word out that the retailer is one of the select...

    Shares of GameStop (GME +2.9%) trade higher with word out that the retailer is one of the select few where a new Nexus 7 can be picked up early. Any upward momentum in GameStop has be viewed through the prism that it is one of the most heavily-shorted S&P 500 stocks.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM
  • FLEX

    Shares of contract manufacturer Flextronics (FLEX +3.6%) enjoy a strong session after FQ1...

    Shares of contract manufacturer Flextronics (FLEX +3.6%) enjoy a strong session after FQ1 results beat expectations. Revenue comes in ahead of both Street estimates and company guidance even as sales fall 3% Y/Y. CEO Mike McNamara says he "continues to see signs of stability in the macro-environment that are encouraging." Outlook: Q2 EPS of $0.19-0.22 on revenue of $6.1-6.4B against consensus of $0.21/ share on $6.08B in sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM
  • INFA

    Shares of Informatica (INFA -4.4%) slide after the company's Q2 report. Guidance (from the CC):...

    Shares of Informatica (INFA -4.4%) slide after the company's Q2 report. Guidance (from the CC): Q3 EPS of $0.30-0.33 on revenue of $220-230M (consensus is $0.32/ share on $220.46M in sales). FY EPS of $1.36-1.46 on sales of $895-935M (consensus is $1.41/ share on $913.42M in sales). In related news, Qlik Technologies (QLIK -2%) slips after reporting earnings Thursday. The company's EPS guidance was a shade short of analysts' estimates at $0.02-0.04/ share for Q3 and $0.37-0.41/ share for the full year.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM
  • HAL

    Halliburton (HAL +3.8%) shares remain undervalued and should be priced at $54.60, Bernstein's...

    Halliburton (HAL +3.8%) shares remain undervalued and should be priced at $54.60, Bernstein's Scott Gruber writes, based on a model of 14x his 2014 EPS forecast of $3.90; $54.60 is 11% higher than the upper end of HAL's recent dutch auction. Gruber thinks the tender offer signifies HAL's confidence in the end-market's demand for shares and indicates it is “more confident" that its Gulf oil liability is "manageable."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM | 3 Comments
  • JCP

    David Einhorn's hedge fund has closed its short position in J.C. Penney (JCP +3.8%) and moved...

    David Einhorn's hedge fund has closed its short position in J.C. Penney (JCP +3.8%) and moved out of a long position in Microsoft (MSFT +0.1%), according to Reuters. Shares of both companies are near session highs following the report.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM | 5 Comments
  • SBUX

    The coffee trade is doing quite well today with shares of Starbucks (SBUX +7%), Dunkin' Brands...

    The coffee trade is doing quite well today with shares of Starbucks (SBUX +7%), Dunkin' Brands (DNKN +6%), and Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR +2.3%) all lively. Though at one time, Starbucks was pegged as a GMCR-killer (via Verismo) and thought to be a thorn to DNKN's expansion plans, the prevailing thought is that the coffee market might be big enough for quite a few players. The very last thing people want to give up is a cup of coffee," notes Lazard Capital.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM
  • CLF

    Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF +8%) is on the move after reporting Q2 results that strongly beat...

    Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF +8%) is on the move after reporting Q2 results that strongly beat expectations, but guidance changes were mixed with a net negative effect and capex was increased substantially at Bloom Lake. Citi's Brian Yu says U.S. iron ore profit was helped because high volumes offset lower prices, and profit from North American coal was a surprise; he had expected a loss.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM | 1 Comment
  • COBR

    Cobra Electronics (COBR -17.7%) slides double-digits after reporting a Q2 net loss of $0.29/...

    Cobra Electronics (COBR -17.7%) slides double-digits after reporting a Q2 net loss of $0.29/ share on $25.6M in revenue, down 12% Y/Y. Gross margin falls 440 bps. Although the company is "implementing several actions in H2 … aimed at significantly improving … financial performance," management still expects "a lower level of operating income in 2013 as compared to 2012." (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:42 PM
  • VRTX

    RBC says the partial clinical hold on Vertex's (VRTX -7.5%) VX-135 "removes a short-term...

    RBC says the partial clinical hold on Vertex's (VRTX -7.5%) VX-135 "removes a short-term competitive overhang" for Gilead Sciences (GILD +2.3%), whose NDA for sofosbuvir was granted FDA priority review on June 7. ISI's Mark Schoenebaum agrees, saying VRTX's setback "puts a large moat around GILD's hepatitis C franchise." In other post-earnings GILD coverage: Atlantic Equities upgrades the shares, Needham's Alan Carr (who is still bullish on VRTX) raises his PT to $70 from $62, Baird downgrades the shares to Neutral, and Goldman's Terence Flynn (who still has a Neutral rating on the stock) lifts his price target to $59, citing the company's "ongoing diversification strategy."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:34 PM | 3 Comments
  • ZNGA

    Zynga's (ZNGA -15.3%) decision not to pursue real-money gambling in the U.S. probably has more...

    Zynga's (ZNGA -15.3%) decision not to pursue real-money gambling in the U.S. probably has more to do with a fear of rubbing shoulders with heavyweights such as Wynn Resorts (WYNN -0.4%) and MGM Resorts (MGM +0.2%) with their deep pockets than concerns a major market doesn't exist for online gambling, according to early analysis. The other interesting angle is Zynga could be positioning itself for a strategic partnership with a company that already has the requisite gaming licenses.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM | 9 Comments
  • SYNM

    Syntroleum (SYNM -0.8%) comes off a trading halt which followed news it has received unsolicited...

    Syntroleum (SYNM -0.8%) comes off a trading halt which followed news it has received unsolicited offers for a potential sale and has hired Piper Jaffray to evaluate interest. Given the favorable commercial environment, SYNM says now is an appropriate time to broadly review its strategic alternatives. Shares had been -9.5% when halted.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM | 3 Comments
  • GENTY

    Midday top 10 gainers: GENT +52%. USU +41%. INPH +40%. PBIB +31%. OTCPK:MKTY +29%. ETRM +21%....

    Midday top 10 gainers: GENT +52%. USU +41%. INPH +40%. PBIB +31%. OTCPK:MKTY +29%. ETRM +21%. CREG +18%. ZHNE +17%. BCOV +17%. URRE +15%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: HTCH -30%. EXPE -25%. SWI -22%. HXM -20%. IPCI -20%. COBR -19%. TSYS -18%. GAI -17%. AIMC -17%. ZNGA -16%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • FET

    Forum Energy Tech (FET -5.9%) is falling after missing its Q2 EPS number and issuing downward...

    Forum Energy Tech (FET -5.9%) is falling after missing its Q2 EPS number and issuing downward guidance; it now sees Q3 EPS of $0.40-$0.45 vs. $0.47 consensus and FY 2013 EPS of $1.55-$1.65 vs. $1.69 consensus. FET says it is not planning for any increase in the U.S. land rig count during H2, and continues to see pricing pressure in drilling technologies and flow equipment.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM
  • XSPA

    Shares of Vringo (VRNG +15.4%) jet higher on more speculation about the direction a patent...

    Shares of Vringo (VRNG +15.4%) jet higher on more speculation about the direction a patent infringement case with Google will go. Double-digit moves are nothing new for the stock which SA contributor Dan Ravicher thinks could see $5 on a favorable outcome.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM | 11 Comments
  • HMY

    Gold is falling and taking gold mining stocks with it, but South Africa’s miners have it...

    Gold is falling and taking gold mining stocks with it, but South Africa’s miners have it worse: HMY -5.8%, SBGL -5.6%, AU -3.4%, GFI -1.9%. The fractious nature of labor relations and the potential for another violent incident is the biggest of many problems, Barclays writes, and getting it right is critical for the country; the sector accounts for 5% of real value added directly and 18% indirectly.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM
  • HTCH

    Shares of Hutchinson Technology (HTCH -29.7%) plummet following the company's FQ3 report. CEO...

    Shares of Hutchinson Technology (HTCH -29.7%) plummet following the company's FQ3 report. CEO Rick Penn says part of the weakness was expected and is attributable to "lower production volume due to inventory usage." However, there were also "some short-term manufacturing inefficiencies" which Penn says have been "resolved." Management expects production volume to rise in Q4 and the company should ship 100-110M suspension assemblies during the period. Average selling prices are expected to be "flat to up slightly." (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM
  • BAS

    Basic Energy Services (BAS -11%) shares plunge after reporting a wider than expected Q2 loss and...

    Basic Energy Services (BAS -11%) shares plunge after reporting a wider than expected Q2 loss and issuing a downbeat outlook for the remainder of the year. Pointing to flat results for Q3, BAS sees production activity remaining at current levels but no longer expects any substantial bump from gas-oriented markets.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM
  • SWI

    SolarWinds' (SWI -21.8%) Q2 earnings jumped 17%, but shares are sinking on disappointing Q3 and...

    SolarWinds' (SWI -21.8%) Q2 earnings jumped 17%, but shares are sinking on disappointing Q3 and full-year guidance. Needham downgrades SWI to Hold from Buy, based on a belief SWI has encountered new challenges layered on top of the difficulties which caused the Q1 miss. Core business seems worse, the firm says, with continued license weakness despite big Y/Y gains in transaction volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM | 1 Comment
  • ZNGA

    Wedbush is out defending Zynga (ZNGA -17.7%) in the midst of a rather nasty post-earnings...

    Wedbush is out defending Zynga (ZNGA -17.7%) in the midst of a rather nasty post-earnings sell-off triggered by the company's decision not to pursue real money gaming in the U.S. A company-wide review by CEO Don Mattrick "will result in a further streamlining of operations [and] will help the company to better focus on its more immediate revenue opportunities," analyst Michael Pachter says, maintaining an Overweight rating and a $4.25 PT. Meanwhile, Canaccord's Michael Graham is "optimistically cautious" based on Mattrick's willingness to "roll up his sleeves" and the company's "cash cushion." (Previous: Needham removes Buy on ZNGA)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM | 6 Comments
  • NTGR

    Netgear's (NTGR -9.6%) Q2 results were "solid," RBC Capital says, but downside Q3 revenue...

    Netgear's (NTGR -9.6%) Q2 results were "solid," RBC Capital says, but downside Q3 revenue guidance prompts the firm to downgrade shares to Underperform with a $27 price target. "The core business is deteriorating and its recently acquired assets are not yet providing the synergistic wins on the carrier side,"RBC says, and guidance implies further weakness; Europe, -8% Y/Y, also is weighing.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM
  • MU

    Micron Technology (MU -5.7%) slides as DigiTimes (citing industry sources) says Q3 NAND flash...

    Micron Technology (MU -5.7%) slides as DigiTimes (citing industry sources) says Q3 NAND flash demand will be weaker than anticipated thanks to "disappointing sales of high-end smartphones." Assumptions about smartphone demand had previously led some to anticipate NAND flash shortages for the quarter (previous). There's also some concern about downward pressure on prices in Q4 due to new capacity (previous). Also having a rough day is SanDisk (SNDK -5.2%).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM | 7 Comments
  • IPCI

    Intellipharmaceutics (IPCI -18%) prices its public offering (1.5M shares) at $2.05/ share. IPCI...

    Intellipharmaceutics (IPCI -18%) prices its public offering (1.5M shares) at $2.05/ share. IPCI is also issuing five-year warrants for an additional 375K shares, exercisable immediately (exercise price is $2.55/ share). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM
  • OUTR

    Shares of Outerwall (OUTR -12.1%) fall hard after the company misses the revenue estimates of...

    Shares of Outerwall (OUTR -12.1%) fall hard after the company misses the revenue estimates of analysts with its Q2 report. The company suffered from a lack of demand for DVD rentals, but is looking to grow as the 35% owner of Redbox Instant and through a new venture to sell fresh-brewed coffee at kiosks.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:04 AM
  • SID

    Siderurgica Nacional (SID +5%) pops at the open after reports say talks concerning the purchase...

    Siderurgica Nacional (SID +5%) pops at the open after reports say talks concerning the purchase of two ThyssenKrupp steel plants broke down; the apparent sticking point is the price of the Alabama facility. An agreement in principle to buy a ~33% stake in ThyssenKrupp's plant in Brazil could be jeopardized; SID wants control of both plants, and sources say if it cant have both, it might walk away.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • OPEN

    Goldman upgrades OpenTable (OPEN +1.6%) to Buy from Neutral (price target $76). Analyst Heath...

    Goldman upgrades OpenTable (OPEN +1.6%) to Buy from Neutral (price target $76). Analyst Heath Terry says the sell-off in the shares triggered by Yelp's acquisition of SeatMe creates "an opportunity ahead of what [Goldman expects] to be a strong quarter of seated diner growth [and] increasing product innovation." Terry also says the 9M reservations per month booked on the site "generates a massive barrier" to entry.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:43 AM
  • HAL

    How to punish Halliburton (HAL +3.7%) for destroying evidence? Add ~$1.4B to its market cap, as...

    How to punish Halliburton (HAL +3.7%) for destroying evidence? Add ~$1.4B to its market cap, as shares surge at the open despite agreeing to plead guilty to destroying evidence in the wake of the Deepwater Horizon disaster. Investors may be focusing on HAL's launching of a $3.3B Dutch auction, through which the company plans to repurchase ~8% of its stock at a price likely above Thursday’s close.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:43 AM | 13 Comments
  • TRIP

    Shares of TripAdvisor (TRIP +1.3%) buck the weakness in the online travel sector to show a gain...

    Shares of TripAdvisor (TRIP +1.3%) buck the weakness in the online travel sector to show a gain in early trading. Unlike some of its peers, Expedia's pain has been Tripadvisor's gain after its meta transition drew traffic away from Expedia (EXPE -22.8%).
     
     
     
     
    | 9:38 AM
  • VRTX

    Needham's Alan Carr keeps a Buy rating on Vertex (VRTX -7.5%) despite the partial clinical hold...

    Needham's Alan Carr keeps a Buy rating on Vertex (VRTX -7.5%) despite the partial clinical hold placed on VX-135. The rationale is pretty simple: Carr hadn't factored VX-135 into his models in the first place. Price target maintained at $95.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:34 AM
  • TRP

    More on TransCanada's (NYSE:TRP) Q2 results: Highlights shipper interest in the Energy East...

    More on TransCanada's (NYSE:TRP) Q2 results: Highlights shipper interest in the Energy East Pipeline project, which would add to TRP's $26B portfolio of commercially secured projects targeted for completion by 2020. Anticipates the Keystone XL pipeline would be in service roughly two years following U.S. approval; says the $5.3B cost estimate would increase depending on the timing of the permit. TRP -3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM | 1 Comment
  • PSO

    Shares of Pearson (NYSE:PSO) are up 7.7% premarket following a H1 report which beat estimates....

    Shares of Pearson (NYSE:PSO) are up 7.7% premarket following a H1 report which beat estimates. The publisher has had success converting services into the digital era, but has more work to do with its educational businesses.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:23 AM

  • Another big late-day move for Thai shares (THD) only this time it's to the upside (previous), as...

    Another big late-day move for Thai shares (THD) only this time it's to the upside (previous), as the SET rallies to close 1.38% higher. Philippine stocks (EPHE) fall 0.54% on the day, but post a solid 2% gain for the week as it appears Moody's may be set to grant Manila an investment grade rating some time in the near future, following in the footsteps of S&P and Fitch. Across the region: The Straits Times (EWS, EWSS) is flat as are Malaysian (EWM) equities, Indonesian shares (EIDO, IDX) slip 0.33%, and stocks in Vietnam (VNM) rise 0.44%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:21 AM
  • RSLS

    Premarket gainers: ETRM +29%. ATVI +14%. KNDI +11%. PSO +8%. SBUX +7%. GILD +5%.  Losers:...

    Premarket gainers: ETRM +29%. ATVI +14%. KNDI +11%. PSO +8%. SBUX +7%. GILD +5%.
    Losers: EXPE -23%. SWI -21%. IPCI -17%. ZNGA -17%. VRTX -9%. CRUS -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM
  • KKR

    More on KKR Q2 earnings: It's a rare miss in what has been a time of high cotton for P-E firms....

    More on KKR Q2 earnings: It's a rare miss in what has been a time of high cotton for P-E firms. Economic net income of $144.4M fell from $546.1M a year ago, as the firm's fund values didn't rise a whole lot. Fee-related earnings of $98.2M up from $69.8M a year ago - a combination of new capital raised and the acquisition of Prisma. AUM of $85.3B up from $78.3B last quarter. Shares -5.4% premarket. CC at 10 ET. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:42 AM
  • IPCI

    Intellipharmaceutics (NASDAQ:IPCI) falls 12% premarket — on top of 13% Thursday —...

    Intellipharmaceutics (NASDAQ:IPCI) falls 12% premarket — on top of 13% Thursday — after the company announces a proposed public offering of common shares and warrants. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:42 AM
  • NEM

    More on Newmont Mining's (NYSE:NEM) Q2 results: Unadjusted $2.1B loss due to a $2.26B writedown...

    More on Newmont Mining's (NYSE:NEM) Q2 results: Unadjusted $2.1B loss due to a $2.26B writedown on the value of stockpiles and its Boddington and Tanami mines in Australia. Attributable gold and copper production of 1.16M oz. and 34M lbs., down 1% and 11% respectively Y/Y. Maintains full-year production outlook. Cuts 2013 capex by another $100M; new capex outlook is $2.2B-$2.4B. NEM -2.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:35 AM
  • GENTY

    The CHMP changes its mind on Gentium's (GENT) Defitelio after the company requests a...

    The CHMP changes its mind on Gentium's (GENT) Defitelio after the company requests a re-examination of a negative opinion rendered in March. The committee now recommends a marketing authorization for the severe hepatic veno-occlusive disease treatment in adults and children undergoing hematopoietic stem cell transplantation therapy "under exceptional circumstances." Shares +43.2% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:35 AM
  • GMCR

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (NASDAQ:GMCR) are up 1% in premarket trading after...

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (NASDAQ:GMCR) are up 1% in premarket trading after Starbucks reported strong numbers yesterday. The fundamentals of the coffee market as tipped off by Starbucks bode well for GMCR, according to traders.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:33 AM
  • ATVI

    Activision (NASDAQ:ATVI) soars 17.9% following news it's buying back $5.8B in shares from...

    Activision (NASDAQ:ATVI) soars 17.9% following news it's buying back $5.8B in shares from Vivendi at $13.60 each (10% discount to last night's close). The deal is expected to boost EPS this year by 23-33%. CEO Bobby Kotick notes the mostly debt-financed purchase allows the company to take advantage of attractive financing while still retaining $3B of cash on hand. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:29 AM | 6 Comments
  • ABBV

    More on AbbVie's (NYSE:ABBV) Q2: Revenue rises 4.4% and 10.3% ex-TriCor/ Trilipix sales (loss of...

    More on AbbVie's (NYSE:ABBV) Q2: Revenue rises 4.4% and 10.3% ex-TriCor/ Trilipix sales (loss of exclusivity) and currency impact. Humira sales rise 12.1% globally and 16% in the U.S. Y/Y sales growth by product: Kaletra, 1.1%; AndroGel, -6.5%; Niaspan, +10%; Lupron, -1%; Synthroid, +24.4%; Sevoflurane, -10.5%; TriCor/ Trilipix, -65.6%; Zemplar, +12.6%; Creon, +20.5%; Synagis, +9.4%; Duodopa, +25.7%. FY13 outlook is raised to $3.07-3.13/ share. Consensus is $3.12/ share. Shares +3% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:21 AM
  • ZNGA

    Needham's Sean McGowan removes his Buy on Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) after last night's earnings and...

    Needham's Sean McGowan removes his Buy on Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) after last night's earnings and news the company won't pursue real money gaming in the U.S. "The company has eliminated much of the potential upside for the stock, while weakness in Poker could indicate that once 'untouchable' pillars of the company are weakening." New CEO Don Mattrick is obviously in the process of remaking the company and warns to expect "increased volatility." Shares -17.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:19 AM
  • BKNG

    Priceline (PCLN) slips 3.2% in premarket trade after the Expedia blowup overnight. Other...

    Priceline (PCLN)slips 3.2% in premarket trade after the Expedia blowup overnight. Other online travel sites: OWW-2.4%, TZOO-0.2%, TRIP-1.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:10 AM | 6 Comments
  • WETF

    More on WisdomTree (NASDAQ:WETF) Q2 earnings: Net income of $12.2M compares to $7.9M in Q1....

    More on WisdomTree (NASDAQ:WETF) Q2 earnings: Net income of $12.2M compares to $7.9M in Q1. Revenue of $37.1M up 27.3% from Q1, up 83.4% from a year ago. Pre-tax margin continues to rise as scale of business grows - 33% in Q2 vs. 27% in Q1, 1% a year ago.ETF AUM of $29B up 93.1% Y/Y. Net inflows of $5B up from $300M a year ago, but down from $5.9B in Q1 (the DXJ gusher). Market share of industry flows of 29.4% vs. 10.8% in Q1 and close to zero a year ago.     Deutsche Bank says Tesla Motors (NASDAQ:TSLA) has "only just begun" as it upgrades the automaker...

    Deutsche Bank says Tesla Motors (NASDAQ:TSLA) has "only just begun" as it upgrades the automaker to a Buy rating and assigns shares a $160 price target. The firm thinks sustained demand for the Model S and its future pipeline along with the company's competitive advantage over other EV sellers will help it achieve lush 20% margins. Working with assumptions for 200K unit production by the end of the decade and up to $3.4B of EBITDA, Deutsche discounts back to arrive at the $160 PT on a 12-month valuation. TSLA +5.6% premarket to $131.04.
